column2: Boss, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I take Marinol 5mg twice a day for bi-polar.  I also take Klonopin 0.5mg twice a day for anxiety.  The combination is ALL that works for me. Not tired, stuck, crying for no reason, or on the flip unable to make my mind slow down...I still deal with depression/mania with the lack of a mood stablizer, but I'd say my combo makes me able to function! I do agree tho that if I could I would definitely prefer thc in it's natural form!

column2: (Patient)
column9: For those looking for a high, dronabinol (Marinol) is not the way to go. Those of us with true medical issues may indeed notice some relief. I cannot say that there was a major decrease in my pain, but my body feels more relaxed, thus not in as much discomfort. Sleep is more restful. Day and night-time spasticity are reduced. I have noticed that after 10 days or so, the effects wane. Halting my use for 2-3 days, has been working for me. I had had to do the same with tramadol (Ultram), but discontinued its use when I achieved no more than 1 day benefit.  I live in Michigan and believe that cannabis offers easier and more convenience titrates. It also offer more ways of use. I do not like having to choose between pain and jail. As a man made product, dronabinol lacks most of the attributes of cannabis. A major plus is in the fact that dronabinol being legal to have in your blood system, and it is safe to purchase. This pill means not having to choose between pain and jail. I use a daily 2.5 capsule. I wish I could also get the 10mg so that I could use it as a topical. This pill cost me a monthly $10 co-pay. Fibrogirl, wrote that Marinol has been a Miracle Drug for her, then followed with since I don't have HIV or the big C it is illegal for me to take in Illinois.  Not true! Most any doctor can prescribe dronabinol. If it can be prescribed, it is legal to take.

column2: Lula, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: Why are doctors prescribing medication of kind to the older people, knowing that bad side effects are usually tripled on elders?Doctors are too quick to prescribe medication that is habit forming, espcecially to older people.  Ninety percent of the Nursing Home guests are taking Zanax.  Why?  In my opinino they can keep the people sedated so they will not bother to ask for assistance.  I have had to get my aunt off of Valium, Seriax, Zanax and Thorazine each time.  She was falling due to being so tranquilized and breaking bones.  My advice to all these doctors is to back off perscribing these to the older people or anyone else for this matter. We have more percription drug addicts on the street today than street drugs.  All you have to do is work in the medical field to know and witness this.  This is cruel.

column2: Happy4U, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After trying Vicodin (many side effects), Morphine (also has side effects) for Chronic Pancreatitis pain I asked my GI Dr in Portland Oregon about Dronabinol and she Rx me 2.5 mg 3x's a day. I took it a few days and I didn't notice much. I was able to sleep at night better though after it kicking in although I took two pills before going to sleep. I decided one day after having severe abdominal pain to increase it to 3 pills all at once and w in an hour I had a very bad reaction. I had difficulty breathing, emotional crying, my heart was racing to 139 bpm, and collapsed/blacked out in the car. I felt as if I was going to die. I was rushed to the hospital by my husband and kids. I had felt as time was going super slow and had day ja vu repetition of the time of check in at the hospital. I was so scared. I know it was my fault for taking 3 pills at once but was expecting a relief in pain and not the outcome of this feeling. I was given Valium IV at the hospital. I have since been skeptical about taking Dronabinol again. I'm currently  taking Morphine although I know it has more side effects and liver damage than if I were to take Dronabinol. I was told at the Hospital I had an allergic reaction to it but also because I took 3 all at once. I asked the Pharmacist about it and he mentioned that it works as if it were stairs working its way up since it's still in our system it accumulates per day, so yes I need to take as prescribed. So far I have used it as a rubbing ointment for pain in my shoulders and have gone without pain for up to 6 hours. I plan to give it another try and hope it helps me with my abdominal pain. My Insurance Thankfully covered it and all I paid was $15 through Kaiser Ins. I hope this info is helpful.

column2: bemejenniferlee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have MS. And my dr. Prescribed marinol for pain&appetite. The drug works wonders.MIRICLE DRUG RIGHT FROM GOD TO A PILL!!! I've had no side effects. It worked the very first time I used it. Only took an hour to kick in after you chew it not swallow.with hot coffee..makes the drugs work faster.any drug.i take 10mg and sometimes more is needed for high tolerance for meds!! You can apply anywhere in the US for disability for the condition you have and once approved medicaide pays for it.so does united health. Just call local social security  office to c what you need to do to qualify. It works in RI. You can also get on medical marijuana program. Ask ur dr. For form and have him sign,dateand list condition.u may have to get form from dept.of health. Not a pb just call local office&they'll mail it out to you. The real thing works just as well. If you can't offord marinol.a sript is about 2300.00 dollars. With medicade it's free or co pay.if you don't have a job or haven't worked in awhile that's ok. They will go by income not work credits.so it would be SSI. If no income still np they will give you a income for disability. Also remember not to use their doctors.u can use any dr you want. Don't let them tell you otherwise.if you live in RI or CONN a great MS. Dr. Is dr.guarnaccio..kathy wall is the best.nurse who takes care of all ur needs. Also if you are on an interferon&it makes you sick try copaxone.no interferons. Those things make you sick&depressed&full of rage. Hope I helped some people wit all this info. Good luck!!

column2: punksunn, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had chronic pain due to osteoartiritis in my left shoulder, hip and ankle.  Also, painful neuropathy in my left leg from the knee down.  The pain meds work, however the side effects make it very difficult to concentrate or focus...a 'scattered-buzzed' feeling.  I had to use marijuana to eliminate those side effects...and it also helped with pain management.  Although I didnt like having to 'smoke' it.  When I was prescribed Marinol, it worked exactly like marijuana.  The Marinol does produce a slight 'high' but this is much more manageable and acceptable than just the pain meds alone.  The Marinol actually eliminates the 'scattered' feeling and I can think clearly and focus easily now.

column2: flyingpigsrule, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It worked very well and fast for weight loss due to loss of appetite and extremely bad nausea and vomiting from idiopathic chronic pancreatitis where all other meds had failed. It was worth it when it got bad enough and worked very well and fast when used, despite the disliked side effect of using it.  I had no trouble stopping but only used it occasionally.  I was told to keep it in the fridge and that makes it harder if needed when I'm out of the house-- usually at medical appts.
